dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 1557 IH: Soledad Canyon Consistency Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Knight (for himself, Ms. Judy Chu of California, Mr. Schiff, and Mr. Sherman) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To withdraw certain lands in Los Angeles County, California, from entry, appropriation, or disposal under the public land laws, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Soledad Canyon Consistency Act.

section.header: Withdrawal of certain lands in Los Angeles County, California

subsection.text: Subject to valid existing rights, if any, the lands described in subsection (b) are withdrawn fromâ€”

paragraph.text: entry, appropriation, or disposal under the public land laws;
location, entry, and patent under the mining laws; and
operation of the mineral leasing, mineral materials, and geothermal leasing laws.

The lands referred to in subsection (a) consist of approximately 640.16 acres depicted as Soledad Canyon Sand & Gravel Mining Project Site on the Bureau of Land Management map entitled Soledad Canyon Map A and dated January 21, 2016.
The map referred to in paragraph (1) shall have the same force and effect as if included in this Act, except that the Secretary of the Interior may correct minor errors in the map.
The Secretary shall make the map referred to in paragraph (1) available in the appropriate offices of the Bureau of Land Management.
